decks.notes: This Esper Control deck focuses on maintaining board control and disrupting the opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and efficient creatures. The deck also utilizes card advantage engines like Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, and Treasure Cruise to draw into key cards quickly. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value by recasting cheap permanents from the graveyard. With a solid mana base and versatile spells, this deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory through careful resource management and strategic plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and powerful spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while controlling the board and setting up game-winning combos, such as using Time Vault with Voltaic Key or Bolas's Citadel with Sensei's Divining Top. It includes powerful card draw and tutor effects, as well as counterspells to protect your own game plan. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game and outvalue the opponent through efficient plays and resource management, ultimately leading to victory through a combination of card advantage and powerful win conditions.

The deck focuses on using Oath of Druids as a key card to cheat powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play. It also utilizes control elements like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its game plan. The inclusion of Show and Tell and Flash allows for additional cheaty strategies, while cards like Black Lotus and Ancestral Recall provide powerful acceleration and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly establishing a dominant board presence with its big creatures.

The main concept of the deck is to control the game by using powerful artifacts and mana acceleration in order to lock down the opponent's resources and eventually win through combos involving cards like Paradox Engine, Time Vault, and The One Ring. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to impede the opponent's game plan, while leveraging cards like Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Oswald Fiddlebender to find and tutor for key pieces to secure victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures and disruption spells to control the game and put pressure on the opponent. It utilizes powerful cards like Collector Ouphe, Oko, Thief of Crowns, and Psychic Frog to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining a fast clock with early creatures like Deathrite Shaman. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Fatal Push to deal with threats. With a mix of disruptive elements and aggressive threats, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a victory.

The main idea of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while gaining incremental advantage through card advantage and resource manipulation. The deck utilizes powerful artifact ramp like Moxen and Black Lotus to quickly establish a strong board presence. It also uses disruptive elements like Force of Will and Strip Mine to control the pace of the game. Additionally, cards like Tezzeret, Bolas's Citadel, and Tinker offer powerful win conditions. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent by efficiently utilizing its resources and disrupting their game plan.

This deck aims to generate a high amount of mana and card advantage through artifacts and powerful spells like Paradoxical Outcome, while also utilizing Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion for additional value. The deck includes a balance of fast mana sources like Moxen and Black Lotus, along with disruptive elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares. The goal is to combo off quickly using Paradoxical Outcome to draw cards and generate mana, setting up a game-winning play with cards like Stock Up or Thundertrap Trainer.

This deck revolves around utilizing powerful artifact cards like Moxen and Time Vault in combination with card draw and tutoring effects to generate a lot of mana and draw into the combo pieces quickly. The goal is to assemble the pieces needed to create a loop with Paradoxical Outcome, bouncing and replaying various artifacts to draw an unlimited number of cards and generate infinite mana. Narset, Parter of Veils and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain provide additional utility and control elements to help protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.
